skill.name: Skill Builder
skill.description: Create new Claude Code Skills with proper YAML frontmatter, progressive disclosure structure, and complete directory organization. Use when you need to build custom skills for specific workflows, generate skill templates, or understand the Claude Skills specification.

security_audit.summary: This is legitimate documentation for creating Claude Code skills. It contains no executable code, network calls, or malicious content. The file is pure markdown documentation with YAML frontmatter explaining skill creation best practices.

content.value_statement: Creating Claude Code skills requires proper YAML formatting and directory structure. This skill guides you through building skills that Claude can autonomously discover and use across all surfaces.
actual_capabilities: Creates skills with proper YAML frontmatter structure
Includes validation checklists for skill publishing
Offers beginner to advanced skill templates
Supports autonomous skill discovery by Claude
limitations: Requires Claude Code 2.0+ or Claude.ai with Skills support
Skills must be in top-level directory (no nesting)
Only name and description fields are used by Claude

best_practices: Front-load keywords in descriptions for better skill matching
Keep SKILL.md under 5KB and move detailed content to separate files
Include both 'what' and 'when' in your skill description
Test your skill by asking Claude to list available skills
anti_patterns: Creating deeply nested skill directories (Claude only scans top-level)
Writing overly long descriptions that exceed 1024 characters
Including executable code directly in SKILL.md instead of referencing scripts
Forgetting to include trigger conditions in descriptions

faq.question: Where should I place my custom skills?
faq.answer: Personal skills go in ~/.claude/skills/ while project-specific skills go in .claude/skills/ within your project root.

faq.question: Can I use subdirectories for organizing skills?
faq.answer: No, Claude Code only detects skills in the top-level of the skills directory. Use descriptive names instead.

faq.question: How does Claude decide when to use my skill?
faq.answer: Claude matches your skill's description against user queries. Include clear trigger keywords in your description.

faq.question: Is my skill data safe and private?
faq.answer: Yes, skills are stored locally on your machine and never transmitted to external services.

faq.question: Why isn't my skill showing up in Claude's list?
faq.answer: Check YAML formatting, ensure proper directory structure, and restart Claude Code to refresh the skill cache.

faq.question: How is this different from Claude's built-in capabilities?
faq.answer: Skills extend Claude with custom workflows and domain-specific knowledge that persist across sessions.
